body.name: MK 01 DIY Gaming Computer Case, ATX Open Chassis Case Rack for ATX/M-ATX/ITX Motherboards, Within 305x245mm, Widely Body Heat Dissipation Design, SSD Motherboards Accessories
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 3 hrs 10 mins
features: [Scope of Application] Support Motherboards within 305x245mm/Support Power Supply: Standard ATX Power Supply/Support: 1 SSD, 1 HDD. ---- (How to Use: Install and use) Complete parts, easy to install
[Good Heat Dissipation Effect]: MK 01Computer Case. The widely body heat dissipation design greatly increases the distance between the graphics cards to ensure a good heat dissipation effect.

[SECC] High Quality Materials. Motherboards Case Made of high quality SECC, has the best craftsmanship, sturdiness, durability, and long service life. Fully protects the graphics card and electronic, keep all cables clean and orderly, and all items in the miner.

[DIY Open Design]: Through this open design, the motherboard is cooler. Sufficient space is reserved between the graphics cards. You can design the internal structure by yourself, assemble more SSDs, memory sticks, graphics cards, more assembly options
[Package List]: 1 x Bottom Plate1 x Backplane, 2 x Fixed Plate, 1 x Screw Pack, 1 x Boot Line, If there is any problem with the installation, please contact us in time, we will solve it for you.
body.description: How to Use: Install and use Specification: Item Type: Open Chassis Material: SECC Model: for MK 01 Color: Black Function: Computer Case Scope of Application: Support Motherboards within 305x245mm (ATX, M‑ATX, ITX) Support Power Supply: Standard ATX Power Supply Size: Approx. 150mm / 5.9in, Approx. 86mm / 3.4in, Approx. 140-250mm / 5.5-9.8in Support: 1 SSD, 1 HDD Package List: 1 x Bottom Plate1 x Backplane 2 x Fixed Plate 1 x Screw Pack 1 x Boot Line Frequently Asked Questions: Q: What motherboards and power supplies are supported by the ATX version of the motherboard A: Support for all ATX, M-ATX, ITX motherboards; support for standard or extended ATX power supplies. Q: support that kind of graphics card, how many graphics cards are supported? A: All graphics cards can be supported, unlimited length and width; the number of graphics cards need to be based on the motherboard PCIE slot and the thickness of the graphics card, generally 3-7 Q: Is it possible to install additional fans? A: The other side of the backplane can be installed with three 12cm fans (such as graphics cards longer will produce interference resulting in the inability to install), can also be used to install 120, 240, 360 water cooling row Q: What is the maximum height of the CPU cooler can support? A: CPU cooler height is not limited

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.2 4.2 out of 5 stars 20 ratings 4.2 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Gets the job done
reviews.reviewText: My philosophy to building PCs is that cases in their entirety are a hinderance to the performance of the PC. You should only ever have a case on your PC if your living situation requires it. You can't just have the motherboard unmounted though, that's bad for it and all of the parts on it. This "case" is the perfect answer to it. It's cheaper than any actual case obviously, less metal means less materials cost. The two most important parts of it, the standoffs and the PCIe card mounting slots, both do what you'd want them to do, nothing more and nothing less.I have only one complaint: the power switch you get to turn the PC on and off while it is perfectly functional does not have a mounting location of any kind for the button.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Decase but do it right
reviews.reviewText: For projects or workbench environment where you don't want or need a full case this is awesome. As others said no instructions, but if you take your time and look at it first it'll be obvious. Includes standoffs, mobo screws, and a simple power button. Just don't use mobo screws to assemble it. Make sure you figure out which screws fit the standoffs and set those aside.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars build quality lacking
reviews.reviewText: holes dont line up and you dont get instructions, but easy enough to figure out

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Decent open PC case
reviews.reviewText: This open PC case is actually quite functional and surprisingly sturdy for what you pay for it. I've subtracted one star for the complete lack of an instruction manual in the box. With the different screw types they include, it was initially difficult to determine which screw was threaded foe what part. Another minor improvement to the design would be to add some small rubber legs to be attached to the bottom so it doesn't scratch the heck out of your desk top.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I like it.
reviews.reviewText: The instructions are very bad, but once you figure it out it seems to be a good case.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent quality and easy assembly
reviews.reviewText: Great open air chassis for DIY builds!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Openings Do Not Line Up
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to use this as a test chassis. The openings do not line up. Was useless and had to return.
Assembly was trivial once I figured out the orientation of the base (edge "walls" down). So much easier to test build components and when not in use I have the option of de-assembly for easy storage.
